title: How to Use Plastic Spoons to Make a Flower

steps.headline: Light the candle and stick it onto a firm base.
steps.description: To do this hold the lighted candle horizontally a little above the base. Drops of wax will fall down. When they do, stick the base of the candle onto the base you want to stick it on.

steps.headline: Hold the back of the head of the spoon horizontally towards the flame.
steps.description: When the sides start curling up, take it off the flame.

steps.headline: Now hold the other side of the spoon's head towards the candle, not for long, just to blacken the other side as well.
Do the same for as many spoons as you want.
Now take two of the spoons you make and stick their necks together by putting one spoon over another in a criss-cross way.

text: Gather your supplies.  Light the candle and stick it onto a firm base. To do this hold the lighted candle horizontally a little above the base. Drops of wax will fall down. When they do, stick the base of the candle onto the base you want to stick it on. Hold the back of the head of the spoon horizontally towards the flame. When the sides start curling up, take it off the flame. Now hold the other side of the spoon's head towards the candle, not for long, just to blacken the other side as well.  Do the same for as many spoons as you want. (about 5 spoons should be sufficient) Now take two of the spoons you make and stick their necks together by putting one spoon over another in a criss-cross way. slightly melt the point of intersection for the spoons to bond. Snip off only ONE of the handles of one of the spoons. Do the same for the remaining spoons.  After you have stuck all the petals, take one of the handles of the spoons you have snipped of and slightly melt the bottom bit and attack it to your flower like a stem. If you prefer it without a stem, you may skip this step. Very slightly burn the stem to make it look like the rest of the flower.  And you're done!
